full_sentence: I disagree with the statement "blacks deserve rights"

Ex-hijabi here, Yes, it is not a choice because the moment you decide not to wear it, the reaction from your muslim family and friends will say it all (unless you're from a more liberal family lucky you). I'm semi-exiled from my dad's side of the family after I removed my hijab. Brothers wont even talk to me either. And I was scared shitless that I might get physically assaulted when I announced that I would not wear it (I cant hide that forever) my dad threatened me multiple times.I come from a Muslim majority country btw so its very hard to be me at the moment.
I really believe that "Love is a grave mental disease..." Plato It might be an overstatement, but there is truth here. What about all women being unpleasant, or even dangerous, huh? Just asking.

African-descended people are famous for being the most persecuted race in history. With the exception of Egypt, many wrongly perceive Africa as a land without civilization suffering from issues such as poverty and brutality.

So are most things in life, nothing is straightforward. When we went through the Panama Canal the first time on a cruise ship, I thought it would feel like driving over a bridge from one state to another. NO, It was an all day affair. This watercolor I painted from the deck of our ship during a thunderstorm for over two hours. Shooting the locks & the manmade lake took all day. And the elevation changed hundreds of feet from the Gulf of Mexico to the Pacific Ocean sides. Surreal and beautiful
